result.executive_summary: An AWS EC2 instance has been identified as potentially compromised and being used for a ransomware attack. The instance is exhibiting signs of rapid file encryption, deletion of shadow copies, and communication with known ransomware command and control infrastructure. The incident poses a high risk of data loss and system disruption, requiring immediate containment and remediation.
attack_chain: Persistence through Lateral Movement and Ransomware Deployment
Impact through Data Encryption and Exfiltration
immediate_actions: Isolate the affected EC2 instance from the network to prevent further spread of the ransomware
Initiate incident response procedures to contain the threat and gather forensic evidence
Notify the appropriate stakeholders and prepare for potential service disruptions
short_term_recommendations: Perform a full scan of the affected instance and the broader environment for indicators of compromise
Implement enhanced monitoring and alerting for suspicious network activity and file system changes
Review and update incident response and business continuity plans to address ransomware scenarios
long_term_recommendations: Implement a comprehensive endpoint protection solution with advanced threat detection and response capabilities
Enhance network segmentation and access controls to limit the potential for lateral movement
Establish a robust backup and recovery strategy to ensure business continuity in the event of a ransomware attack
investigation_queries: Identify all network connections made by the affected EC2 instance, including destination IP addresses and ports
Analyze the file system of the affected instance to identify any encrypted files or deleted shadow copies
Search for any other instances or systems that may have communicated with the known ransomware command and control infrastructure
